A **war hammer** is a type of one-handed [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is the [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") for the [artifact weapons](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") [Mjollnir](/wiki/Mjollnir "Mjollnir") and [Ogresmasher](/wiki/Ogresmasher "Ogresmasher").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Hammer skill](#Hammer_skill)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [3.1 Average damage calculation](#Average_damage_calculation)

- [4 History](#History)

  - [6.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)

  - [6.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [7 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [8 References](#References)

## Generation

War hammers make up \~1.5% of randomly generated weapons. General [stores](/wiki/Store "Store"), antique weapon outlets and used armor dealerships can sell war hammers.

[Player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster"), including those on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane"), have a \~1.3% chance of generating with a war hammer as their initial weapon before role-based replacements[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) - as with other player monster weapons on the Astral Plane, the hammer has a 1⁄2 chance of being made into either Mjollnir or Ogresmasher if neither weapon has been generated.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) [Valkyries](/wiki/Valkyrie_\(player_monster\) "Valkyrie (player monster)") have a 1⁄2 chance of forcing a war hammer as their weapon.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

## Hammer skill

| Hammer  |                                                                                                                                      |
| ------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| Max     | [Role](/wiki/Role "Role")                                                                                                            |
| Basic   | - [Knight](/wiki/Knight "Knight"), [Rogue](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue"), [Ranger](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger"), [Tourist](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist") |
| Skilled | * [Caveman](/wiki/Caveman "Caveman")                                                                                                 |
| Expert  | - [Barbarian](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian"), [Priest](/wiki/Priest "Priest"), [Valkyrie](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie")                   |

The war hammer is the only weapon to use the **hammer** [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill") in vanilla *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. The [lucern hammer](/wiki/Lucern_hammer "Lucern hammer") is a type of [polearm](/wiki/Polearm "Polearm") and uses this skill instead.

## Strategy

The war hammer is generally an unremarkable weapon, with lower damage than the [mace](/wiki/Mace "Mace") and the [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword"). As a weapon skill, it is most relevant for those who find or receive Ogresmasher or Mjollnir.

### Average damage calculation

The average damage calculations in the following table do not include bonuses from weapon skills, [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength"), or from using a [blessed](/wiki/Blessed "Blessed") weapon against [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead") or [demons](/wiki/M2_DEMON "M2 DEMON").

| Weapon        | Small monsters                                                                            | Large monsters                                                                         |
| ------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| +0 war hammer | ![\frac{1+4}{2}+1=\bold{3.5}](/images/math/d/b/0/db070244d2d81b8de2a2199b3241ec18.png)    | ![\frac{1+4}{2}=\bold{2.5}](/images/math/0/a/8/0a8b6370405d301c79328531ca63387e.png)   |
| +7 war hammer | ![\frac{1+4}{2}+1+7=\bold{10.5}](/images/math/8/9/e/89e542ba3a95f0c608df2661389c589c.png) | ![\frac{1+4}{2}+7=\bold{9.5}](/images/math/4/9/7/497c7c0c1a9bd4a1521d86ae28d1faa6.png) |

## History

The war hammer first appears in [NetHack 3.0.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.3 "NetHack 3.0.3").

The lucern hammer, which first appeas in [NetHack 1.3d](/wiki/NetHack_1.3d "NetHack 1.3d"), was erroneously classified as using the hammer skill rather than [polearm](/wiki/Polearm "Polearm") skill - this mistake was carried over from early editions of *[Dungeons & Dragons](/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons "Dungeons & Dragons")*. In [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"), this led to [Thunderfist](/wiki/Thunderfist "Thunderfist") (the predecessor of Mjollnir) and Ogresmasher having the base item of a lucern hammer instead; the war hammer was introduced in part to correct this mistake.

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[War hammer](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_hammer "wikipedia:War hammer")***

[![](/images/thumb/5/5d/Polish_Horseman%27s_picks_from_XVII_century.jpg/150px-Polish_Horseman%27s_picks_from_XVII_century.jpg)](/wiki/File:Polish_Horseman%27s_picks_from_XVII_century.jpg)



A horseman's pick, an example of a real-world type of war hammer

The war hammer is a weapon that was formerly used in warfare, dating back to as far as the 2nd century BCE. Real-world war hammers were quite versatile weapons and were important for facing heavily-armored opponents much like [maces](/wiki/Mace "Mace"). The blunt hammerhead would deliver concussive force through thick armor - including most chain mail and even plate mail - and the pick end on the opposite face could be used to punch holes, whether through a piece of armor or the odd skull. They could also be used in grappling.

The war hammer's hit die are derived from *[Advanced Dungeons & Dragons](/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons "Dungeons & Dragons")*.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") adds a new type of hammer in the [heavy hammer](/wiki/Heavy_hammer "Heavy hammer"), which is stronger than the war hammer and acts as the new base item for Mjollnir.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), the war hammer deals 1d8+1 bludgeoning damage to small monsters and 1d8 bludgeoning damage to large ones, and can be thrown with no to-hit penalty.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), war hammers are made into a two-handed weapon that deals 2d6 damage to small creatures and 2d8 to large creatures.

### EvilHack

[EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") adds the [heavy war hammer](/wiki/Heavy_war_hammer "Heavy war hammer"), a stronger type of hammer that acts as the new base item for Mjollnir and Ogresmasher. Hammers of any kind can also be wielded while standing on a square with a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") to create new weapons, armor and other objects, including even [artifacts](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact").

A war hammer can be created at a forge by combining a [flail](/wiki/Flail "Flail") and a [mace](/wiki/Mace "Mace"). War hammers can be used to create a few other items:

- Two war hammers can be combined to create a heavy war hammer.
- A war hammer can be combined with a [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear") to create a [bec de corbin](/wiki/Bec_de_corbin "Bec de corbin").
- A war hammer can be combined with a [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife") to create a [dented pot](/wiki/Dented_pot "Dented pot").

## Encyclopedia entry

They had come together at the ford of the Trident while the battle crashed around them, Robert with his warhammer and his great antlered helm, the Targaryen prince armored all in black. On his breastplate was the three-headed dragon of his House, wrought all in rubies that flashed like fire in the sunlight. The waters of the Trident ran red around the hooves of their destriers as they circled and clashed, again and again, until at last a crushing blow from Robert's hammer stove in the dragon and the chest behind it. When Ned had finally come on the scene, Rhaegar lay dead in the stream, while men of both armies scrambled in the swirling waters for rubies knocked free of his armor.

\[ A Game of Thrones, by George R.R. Martin ]
